1.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From eklegomai; select; by implication, favorite.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.

2.str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

2.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular

2.str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Not guilty of falsehood, truthful. Veracious.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.

3.str2: Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A proclamation, preaching. From kerusso; a proclamation.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Instruction, command, order, authority. From epitasso; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.

4.str2: Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.
From the same as genesia; legitimate, i.e. Genuine.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Probably from sun; common, i.e. shared by all or several, or profane.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.

5.str2: Accusative case of charis as preposition; through favor of, i.e. On account of.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
5.str2: From apo and leipo; to leave behind; by implication, to forsake.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Crete. Of uncertain derivation; Crete, an island in the Mediterranean.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: From epi and a derivative of orthos; to straighten further, i.e. arrange additionally.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
5.str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
5.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
5.str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

6.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
6.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
An accusation, charge. From kategoros; a complaint, i.e. Criminal charge.
Wantonness, profligacy, wastefulness. From a compound of a and a presumed derivative of sozo; properly, unsavedness, i.e. profligacy.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Not subject to rule, unruly. Unsubdued, i.e. Insubordinate.

7.str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A household manager, a steward, guardian.
From epi and skopos; a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a church.

Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Prone to anger, passionate. From orge; irascible.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Given to wine, drunken, quarrelsome. From para and oinos; staying near wine, i.e. Tippling.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A striker, contentious person, brawler. From plesso; a smiter, i.e. Pugnacious.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Greedy, fond of base gain. From aischros and kerdos; sordid.

8.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Hospitable, loving strangers. From philos and xenos; fond of guests, i.e. Hospitable.
Loving what is good. From philos and agathos; fond to good, i.e. A promoter of virtue.
From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
Holy, pious, godly, beloved of God. Of uncertain affinity; properly, right, i.e. Hallowed.
Self-controlled. From en and kratos; strong in a thing, i.e. self-controlled.

Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

Not subject to rule, unruly. Unsubdued, i.e. Insubordinate.

A deceiver, seducer. From phren and apate; a mind-misleader, i.e. Seducer.
Most of all, especially. Neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb mala; most or particularly.

Accusative case of charis as preposition; through favor of, i.e. On account of.
Base, disgraceful. From the same as aischunomai; shameful, i.e. Base.
Gain, advantage, profit. Of uncertain affinity; gain.

All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.
A liar, deceiver. From pseudomai; a falsifier.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.
The stomach; by analogy, the matrix; figuratively, a gourmand.

13.str2: Witness, evidence, testimony, reputation. From martus; evidence given.

Unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful. TRUE.
From the same as aiteo; a cause, i.e. reason, crime.

In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

Jewish, Judaic. From Ioudaios; Judaic, i.e. Resembling a Judaean.
An idle tale, fable, fanciful story. Perhaps from the same as mueo; a tale, i.e. Fiction.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

A primary particle; but, and, etc.

From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
